t: Come,*pn and let us return to the Lord;*s For*ld He has torn, but He will heal us; He*ld has stricken, but He will bind us up.
After*ld two days He will revive us; On*ld the third day He will raise us up, That*ld we may live in His sight.
Let*ld us know, Let*ld us pursue the knowledge of the Lord.*s His*ld going forth is established as the morning; He*ld will come to us like the rain, Like*ld the latter and*i former rain to the earth.
“O*pn Ephraim, what shall I do to you? O*ld Judah, what shall I do to you? For*ld your faithfulness is like a morning cloud, And*ld like the early dew it goes away.
Therefore*ld I have hewn them*i by the prophets, I*ld have slain them by the words of My mouth; And*ld your judgments are*i like*i light that*i goes forth.
For*ld I desire mercy and not sacrifice, And*ld the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
“But*ln like men they transgressed the covenant; There*ld they dealt treacherously with Me.
Gilead*ld is*i a city of evildoers And*ild defiled with blood.
As*ld bands of robbers lie in wait for a man, So*ild the company of priests murder on the way to Shechem; Surely*ld they commit lewdness.
I*ld have seen a horrible thing in the house of Israel: There*ld is*i the harlotry of Ephraim; Israel*ld is defiled.
Also,*ld O Judah, a harvest is appointed for you, When*ld I return the captives of My people.
